intro: Phaca longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf phaca, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in saline environments. Its leaves are long and narrow, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, making it a distinctive feature of its habitat.
